issue.title: Syncthing walking the same folder twice
issue.body:
Since upgrading the app to 0.10.5 I encountered a serious showstopper that renders the app unusable. It occurs both using experimental root and not using the experimental root feature.

Reproduction:
- Clear app data and caches (if the app was not fresh installed)
- Setup folder "/storage/emulated/0" as syncthing folder read-write with default settings and scan interval 10 minutes (you can use another scan interval as well - I used this one)
- Setup the ignore list before the first scan to ignore special folder
`(?i)/.android_secure
(?i)/Android/data/**/cache
(?i)/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid/files/*
(?i)/Android/data/com.nutomic.syncthingandroid.debug/files/*
(?i)/com.infosysta.mobile.jirapro
(?i)/DCIM/.thumbnails
(?i)/Domoticz
(?i)/LOST.DIR
(?i)/Sygic/Maps
(?i)/Tasker/log/*
(?i)/TWRP/Backups`
- Syncthing walks the folder - displays "Scanning".... 
- Scanning reaches 100% after some seconds (Note - I have only ~ 1.500 files with the above mentioned ignore patterns) and the scan finishes.
- Folder displays state as "current" (translated from german)
- I took a note of how many files are displayed for that folder in the syncthing web GUI = 1.500 files.
- After around 10 seconds, the "scanning" appears again (I did not add, change, delete files).
- The folder is rescanned "by syncthing itself" without any user interaction
- The scan finishes again very quickly after reaching "100%"
- Folder displays state as "current" (translated from german)
- I took a note of how many files are displayed for that folder in the syncthing web GUI = 3.000 files.
- The file count is twice as high as after the first scan.
- Now the folder stays "idle" until the rescan interval passed by.
- I took a full log with STTRACE=scanner (enabled before the test, attached)

Looking at the log "as being no expert", I suspect it is scanning the folder named "." within "/storage/emulated/0" which causes the double amount of files in the web gui report of the folder. At first glance, the first "real to hash" is called for e.g. "somefolder/somefile.txt" and later, during the "second scan" for "/somefolder/somefile.txt".

### Version Information

    App Version: 0.10.5
    Syncthing Version: v0.14.45
    Android Version: Android 7.1.2 @ lg-h815 (LineAgeOS 2017-11-07)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Can we have a quick bugfix release for syncthing and syncthing android?
Currently this makes my ignore list broken on my phone and I cannot sync between my pc and phone anymore at all.
Ignore list broken? Yes. It seems this bug kills the ignore function too. 
Lets say i sync the android phone root folder /0/. In this folder there are two other syncthing folders which I sync too but they are both in the ignore list of the root folder /0/. 
sync instance for /0/ now has all the files added which actually were ignored before updating! They are not ignored anymore.
Hope this could help a bit.

@DrSchnagels The broken ignore patterns are rooted (`/...`), right? As a quick workaround you may be able to use non-rooted patterns, e.g. `Android` instead of `/Android`.

Btw, I don't see how any change between 0.14.44-0.14.45 should have had any influence on this problem, as far as I can see it should be present since introducing fs.

@Catfriend1 It's not as far as I can see. Also conceptually there is no real connection. As @calmh wrote, at the moment it looks like this problem is present since 0.14.37. As it needs a specific condition (scan request on an absolute path by rest API) and problems came up on Android, it is possible that something changed there on this update.

EDIT: The culprit (well sort of) is https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/4671: Before that `unifySubs([]string{"/foo"})` returned `nil`, now `/foo`.

@imsodin 
Thanks. I removed all / in my ignore pattern for /0/.
But now i get this error, but Telegram is not in the ignore file. I actually want the /0/Telegram to be synced with my pc.
After removing the /, i dont get any connection at all between PC and phone.

`[xsxs] 18:34:17 INFO: Established secure connection to yaya at 192.168.10.167:55034-192.168.10.149:22000/tcp-client (TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305)
[xsxs] 18:34:17 INFO: Device yaya client is "syncthing v0.14.45" named "handy" at 192.168.10.167:55034-192.168.10.149:22000/tcp-client
[xsxs] 18:34:17 INFO: Connection to yaya at 192.168.10.167:55034-192.168.10.149:22000/tcp-client closed: protocol error: index: "/Telegram": filename is invalid`

That's Syncthing correctly rejecting an index with a file with a path starting with `/`. It seems a bit extreme and useless to drop the connection due to that, but that's just a symptom. As the invalid file was already scanned, you cannot do anything except wait for the fixed version or remove the entire database on the Android device (i.e. full rescan).

I did delete the syncthing apps database in the apps settings (delete app data). And reset the database within the app.
This didnt work for our problem here and just very curiously, the app never rescaned. (reset database does not seem to work?).
The scan was done without waiting at all... and that with more than 30 GB (OP5).
Then it definitely didn't happen, no idea why. But I didn't think anyway - if you are still on the same version, the problem will just occur again anyway.

I started getting those messages after 0.14.45 upgrade:
```
Connection to IDIDID_2 at IP_LOCAL:53347-IP_WAN:22047/relay-server closed: protocol error: index update: "/.stversions": filename is invalid
[IDIDID] 09:05:36 INFO: Completed initial scan of readwrite folder Andrey-PC-Music
[IDIDID] 09:07:23 INFO: Established secure connection to IDIDID_2 at IP_LOCAL:53471-IP_WAN:22047/relay-server (TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305)
[IDIDID] 09:07:23 INFO: Device IDIDID_2 client is "syncthing v0.14.45" named "DEVICE" at IP_LOCAL:53471-IP_WAN:22047/relay-server
[IDIDID] 09:07:25 INFO: Connection to IDIDID_2 at 10.0.0.5:53471-IP_WAN:22047/relay-server closed: protocol error: index update: "/.stversions": filename is invalid
```
The device is Win10x64, the remote device (IDIDID_2) is Android, all run ST v0.14.45

Does it belong to this issue?

Yes. 

> (@imsodin)  The culprit (well sort of) is #4671: Before that unifySubs([]string{"/foo"}) returned nil, now /foo.

So I guess if Android had been doing this all the time, it was fine up until 0.14.44 at which point it became a problem. Now those devices have index entries that are not accepted in other places. So we might want Android users upgraded to 0.14.46-rc.1 when we release that, with the fix for this.
Hi @calmh !   Is there a way to roll back to 0.14.44 since that was working? Plus does this roll back has to happen only in Android devices to resolve the issue? Thanks!!!
